oai_dc:dc.dc:title: List of articles lost or destroyed in the public service

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: United States -- Army -- Tennessee Cavalry Regiment, 5th (1862-1865); Robinson, Wingate Truitt, 1832-1903; Tennessee -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865 -- Regimental histories; United States -- Army -- Procurement
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: One-page printed Form No. 43, folded and printed on both sides, listing articles lost or destroyed in the public service at Fayetteville, Tennessee, in possession and charge of W. T. Robinson, 1st Lieutenant, Company K, 5th Tennessee Cavalry Volunteers, in the month of March 1865.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: United States -- Army -- Quartermaster's Dept.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: During the Civil War the Quartermaster's Department under the leadership of Montgomery C. Meigs provided supplies for the half-million men in the Union Army, ran the Army's first major depot system, and transported unprecedented levels of supplies and personnel. In 1862 the Quartermaster Department also assumed responsibility for burial of war dead and care of national cemeteries.
